string.value: Please refrain from using foul language in this game.
Verbal and other forms of abuse will NOT be tolerated. Abusers will be blocked from the game.
Our Game Masters will NEVER ask for your login ID, password, pin, or personal information.
NEVER give out your ID, password, or pin to ANYONE including administrators.
Users abusing the Terms of Service will be blocked from the game.
Using, selling, trading, or promoting hacking or hacking tools will result in being blocked from the game.
You can use the 'System Option' in the menu to change your settings--sound, graphics, etc.
Use the 'Game Option' at the menu to change settings for chat, trade requests, whisper, and more.
Type '/?' in the textbox to see a list of available game commands.
Cash items can be bought in the Cash Shop using NX purchased from our website.
NEVER open an unknown attachment file from an instant messenger window or an email.
MapleStory Game Masters will NEVER send you files or contact you outside of the game.

This is an online game and online interaction involves communicating with strangers. NEVER give out your personal information such as your name, age, phone number, address to ANYONE you do not know. Protect your identity!
Ahoy matey! A new job has been added: Pirates! Head to the Nautilus Port today and join the ranks!
When you wear a Cash Equip Item over a regular Equip Item, the function of the regular Equip Item will be maintained while the external features of the Cash Equip Item are displayed.
The Cash Items can neither be traded nor dropped.
To send a Cash Item as a gift, click the 'Gift' button of the item you wish to send and enter the character name of the recipient.
In order to prevent hacks, do not download or open email attachment from an untrusted source.
Cash and Mesos cannot be traded. Cash transaction will result in game use restrictions.
To use the Cash Item you have purchased, double-click and place the item in your Inventory.
Login may be prohibited without any notification if you are found using a macro-assisted (auto-hunting) program.
Mesos and Items cannot be duplicated. Fraudulent activities are strictly forbidden.
Please note, too much game-playing may be damaging to your health.
Restrictions you incur from using unlawful programs cannot be compensated.
You can send Items and Mesos to other users using (NPC)Duey's Package Service.
When using a public computer, confirm the security programs and change your password on your private computer after use.
Remember not to provide your ID and PW anywhere outside of the official website.
Visiting a website that has not been confirmed may pose hack risks.
You are encouraged to select a password that consists of both numbers and letters, and periodically change the password.
Use HotKey's (I,E,S,K,G,W,M,R,H) to conveniently access all menus quickly.
To designate an item to a HotKey, drag the item from your inventory to the quick slot.
Look for hidden portals to expand your adventure!
Press F1~F7 to make various facial expressions.
Use the portal on a map to move on to a different area.
Most portals are displayed on the minimap as a blue dot.
Once you leave to Victoria Island, you may not return Maple Island.
Click on 'Detail' at the stat window for a detailed look at your character stats.
Other characters around you will be displayed on the minimap as red dots.
Stand still for a period of time to slowly regain health.
To pick up an item, press 'Z' or '0' on the number pad.
Press CTRL to attack, ALT to jump.
Visit stores to purchase potions and equipment necessary for your journey.
Once you have leveled up, go to the stat window to assign your ability points acquired through leveling up.
You may only choose one job class. Once you have completed the first job advancement, your character's development path is fixed to the selected class.
To equip an item, go to the equipment inventory and drag the item onto equipped items window or just double-click the desired item in your equipment inventory.
Press 'W' to view the world map.
Press 'E' to view your equipped items.
Press 'I' to open your item inventory window.
Press 'M' to view the minimap.
Press 'K' to open the skill window.
Press 'S' to view your character stats.
To create a party, type '/makeparty' in the textbox. If you create a party, you are the party leader.

As the party leader, you may invite members to your party. To invite a member, type '/partyinvite character-name'in the textbox or right-click the intended character and press "Invite Party". (max 6 members)
As the party leader, type '/partyexpel' character-name to expel a member from your party.
To leave a party, type '/leaveparty'.
To view your party's information, type '/partyinfo'.
To raise or drop someone's fame level, right-click and rate their fame in the character info.
You can raise or drop someone's fame level once a day.
Visit the job instructors in each town to make a job advancement.
To become a magician, make the job advancement at level 8. The other job classes require a minimum level of 10.
To view your friends, party and/or guild membership, click on 'R'.
To leave a guild, input 'leaveguild'.
Visit town stores where you can purchase equipments and potions.
Some items have gender and job limitations. Please be aware of them before making a purchase.
You may only choose one job class. Once you have completed the first job advancement, your character's development path is fixed to the selected class.
Once the job advancement is complete, be careful as every death will cost your character some EXP.
Through quests, you may be able to acquire items unavailable in stores.
More inventory slots are added once you make the job advancement.
Make the job advancement at the earliest level allowed for your class. Skill points will not be granted for levels before the job advancement.
Type '/trade character-name' to request a trade with a user.
To become a magician, make the job advancement at level 8. The other job classes require a minimum level of 10.

As the party leader, you may invite members to your party. To invite a member, type '/partyinvite character-name'in the textbox or right-click the intended character and press "Invite Party". (max 6 members)
As the party leader, type '/partyexpel' character-name to expel a member from your party.
To leave a party, type '/leaveparty'.
To view your party's information, type '/partyinfo'.
To raise or drop someone's fame level, right-click another character and rate their fame in the character info.
You can raise or drop someone's fame level once a day.
To fame or defame someone, right-click on that person and a +/- option will appear.
You can only fame or defame once per day.
You can only fame or defame the same character once per month.
The 2nd job advancement is available at level 30 (requires 1st job advancement).
Passive skills work automatically after acquiring them.
To use an active skill, drag it out of the skill window and place it over Quick Slot to designate it with a HotKey.
All skill points earned before level 30 must be applied before making the 2nd job adv.
Make the job advancement at the earliest level allowed for your class. Skill points will not be granted for levels before the job advancement.
After the job advancement, you'll be awarded with some skill points after every level up.
Skill points can be assigned at the 'Skill' window.
Be careful of powerful monsters in the underground dungeon!
Defeat a powerful monster or complete a quest to acquire rare items not found in stores.
Mana Points (MP) slowly recovers over time.
The skills that require Mana Points will not work if your MP bar is empty.
Type '/trade character-name' to request a trade with a user.
Use the town-returning scrolls to revisit to a town quickly.
Throwing stars will not disappear from your inventory when exhausted. They can be recharged in the armor shop of each town.
Throwing-Stars and Bullets can be recharged at the Weapons Shop and General Shop located in each town.
The 2nd job advancement is available at level 30 after the 1st job advancement.
Meso Magnets and Item Pouches are now available for your Pets in the Cash Shop.
All skill points earned before level 30 must be applied before making the 2nd job adv.
It is recommended use skill points gained after level 30 on 2nd job skills.
Apply various scrolls to your weapons and armors to improve their stats.
There's a 24-Hr store available deep in the underground dungeon where you can purchase powerful potions not available in towns.
When making the 2nd job adv., the Warrior may choose one of these three jobs available: Fighter, Page, or Spearman.
When making the 2nd job adv., the Bowman may choose one of these two jobs available: Hunter or Crossbowman..
When making the 2nd job adv., the Magician may choose one of these three jobs available: Wizard (Fire & Poison / Ice & Lightning) or Cleric
When making the 2nd job adv., the Thief may choose one of these two jobs available: Assassin or Bandit
When making the 2nd job adv., the Pirate may choose one of these two jobs available: Gunslinger or Brawler
Some quests and items require a certain level of fame.
The 3rd job advancement is available at level 70 (requires 2nd job advancement).
All skill points earned before level 70 must be applied before making the 3rd job adv.
Use the sauna at Sleepywood Hotel to recover your HP and MP faster.
Some monsters are weak to certain elemental attacks.
Some quests may be repeated even when cleared.
By completing a quest, you may acquire the skill that allows you to ride a tamed monster.
You can learn a skill that will allow you to ride on top of monsters that you've trained through quests.
The 4th job advancement is available at level 120 after 3rd job adv.
It's best for you to use your skill points gained after level 120 AFTER the 4th job adv.
All skill points earned before level 120 must be applied before making the 4th job adv.
Cash items can be bought in the Cash Shop using NX purchased from our website.
Trading items for NX gifts is NOT allowed. Such trades will result in being blocked from the game.
Account sharing, selling, or trading is STRICTLY FORBIDDEN. Such accounts will be blocked.
You can obtain a mount by catching one--see Kenta in the Aquarium Zoo for more details!
You can upgrade your mount by completing a quest, see Kenta in the Aquarium Zoo for more details!
You can sometimes upgrade 4th job skills by learning mastery books. Good luck!
You can sometimes upgrade 4th job skills by completing quests. Good luck!
You can sometimes upgrade 4th job skills only if you have the conditions for starting a quest. Good luck!
Each town has a general shop where you can purchase equipment and potions.
Certain items are restricted based on gender and jobs. Please be sure to check the restrictions when purchasing an item.
Once you make your 1st Job advancement, you cannot select a different Job with that character.
When you revive after making a job advancement, you will lose some EXP, so be careful!
When you complete a quest, you may be able to acquire an item that you normally can't purchase from the store.
When you make a job advancement, you will gain additional slots in your inventory.
If you have trained your job advancement past the minimum level required for making that advancement, you can still receive your lost Skill Points until you reach level 29.
If you type '/trade [CharacterName]' in the chat window, the exchange window will open.
You can become a Magician at level 8, and all other classes at level 10.
If you want to create a party, then type '/makeparty' in the chat window.
If you want to invite someone to the party, type in '/partyinvite [character name]'.
If you want to force a character to leave the party, then type in '/partyexpel [character name]'.
If you want to leave the party, then type in '/leaveparty'.
If you would like to see the party information, then type in '/partyinfo'.
If the party leader wishes to invite someone to the party, then right click on the character and the 'party invitation' function will appear.
To raise or lower a character's Fame, right click on the character and the +/- function will appear.
Fame can be either raised or lowered only once per day.
You can only raise or lower the Fame of a character once per month.
Job advancements take place at each town's guild. Henesys - Bowmen, Perion - Warriors, Ellinia - Mages, Kerning City - Thieves, Nautilus Port - Pirates
Passive skills are applied automatically once you have and increase points in that skill.
If you want to use your active skills, drag over the icon to the Skill window and set up short-cut keys for use.
Each town has class-based equipment particular to that town for sale.
If you level up without making your job advancement at the level you are able to advance at, you will not be given your Skill Points.
If you level up after you make your job advancement, you will be given Skill Points.
You can use your skill points in the 'Skill' window.
Powerful monsters inhabit the underground dungeons, so please be careful!
If you defeat a powerful monster, you will be able to obtain a valuable item which you cannot buy from a store.
After some time passes, your magical energy (MP) will regenerate.
Any skill that requires magical energy (MP) cannot be used without magical energy.
If you select '/trade [CharacterName]' in the chat window, the exchange window will open.
If you use the "Return Scroll" you will be able to get back to the town much more quickly and easily.
Even when you have finished using all of your throwing-stars and/or bullets and the number goes down to 0, they do not ever completely disappear--you must recharge them.
Throwing-stars or bullets can be recharged at the weapon shop or the general shop of each town and be reused.
The dash skill can be used with the arrow keys ->-> or <-<-.
When making the 2nd job advancement, Pirates can choose between a Gunslinger and a Brawler.
When the Pirate's 3rd level transformation skill is being used, only the pirate-exclusive skills can be used.
All skill points gained after level 30 are better off being distributed after the 2nd job advancement.
If you do not distribute all the skill points you have accumulated by level 30, you will not be able to make your 2nd job advancement.
There are some skills that overlap with other skills and therefore are not used.
You can make powerful weapons and armor using a variety of scrolls.
Deep inside the underground dungeons are powerful potions that cannot be purchased from general shops in the towns.
When making the 2nd job advancement, Pirates can choose between a Gunslinger and a Brawler.
Some quests and items have popularity restrictions.
Elemental bullets allow you to make much more powerful elemental attacks compared to attacks made with general bullets.
Elemental-exclusive bullets can only be used for making elemental attacks.
3rd job advancements can be made after the 2nd job advancement, when you reach level 70.
All skill points acquired after reach level 70 are better off being distributed after the 3rd job advancement.
If you don't distribute all of the skill points accumulated up to level 70, you will not be able to make the 3rd job advancement.
There are some quests that you can repeat even if you've cleared it once.
If you use the sauna in Sleepywood, you will be able to recover your HP and MP much more quickly.
The 2nd Job Advancement skill set of a magician differs. These skills are elemental-based, and damages each monster differently.
You can learn the skill needed to ride on a Mount by completing a quest.
While the Pirate's 3rd, 4th level transformation and/or riding skills are in use, only pirate-exclusive skills can be used.
